results.title: Telephone exchange
results.creator_credit: David Cons, Denis Ward and Technical and Scientific Films
results.brief_description: Shows by diagrams, models and live action the basic working of an automatic telephone exchange. Comparisons with a manual exchange. Demonstrates working of a uniselector, dialling a number and the subsequent connection. Shows correct method of dialling.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Cons, Denis Ward and Technical and Scientific Films

results.title: Telephone etiquette
results.brief_description: Telephone etiquette is vitally important in ensuring effective information flow. This short instructional video covers the main points in telephone etiquette, including identification of the caller/receiver of the call; politeness; using answering machines; tact and discretion and how to deal with difficult customers.

results.title: Telecommunications and industrial electronics
results.creator_credit: Wolfgang Kress and RMIT. Communications Industries Division
results.brief_description: Illustrates the wide application of training received during courses in communications and electronics at RMIT. Looks at the work of technicians employed by the PMG, television stations, the SEC, Bureau of Meteorology, oil refineries, electronic equipment manufacturers, and the work of an audio-visual technician. Indicates the importance and variety of these jobs.

results.title: Teiva
results.creator_credit: Francis Maziere, Theodora Olembert, Edition Francaise Cinematographique and Triangle Film Productions
results.brief_description: An important day in the life of a Tahitian boy, Teiva, living on the island of Bora Bora. He begins his day by seeing his father off on a fishing expedition, explores the waters close to the island, then sets off in his canoe across the lagoon to a volcanic island on the other side. He has set himself the task of climbing the high mountain on the island and returning before nightfall as a test of his manhood. He succeeds and returns home tired but contented.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Francis Maziere, Theodora Olembert, Edition Francaise Cinematographique and Triangle Film Productions

results.title: Teine Samoa: a girl of Samoa
results.creator_credit: John Anderson, Dave Gibson and Gibson Film Productions
results.brief_description: The story of Situe, a 19 year old girl living in a small village in the Pacific Islands of Western Samoa. Through her eyes, the film looks at village life and the expectations of the young educated girl who is faced with the choice of either remaining with her family or seeking a life further afield.

results.title: Teeth we need them!
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Stanley Dalby and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Animated song and dance show stressing the need to take care of teeth and prevent tooth decay. Intended for primary and junior secondary school students.

results.title: Teeny-Tiny and the witch-woman
results.creator_credit: Gene Deitch, Morton Schindel, Kratky Film and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: This Turkish folktale relates the adventures of Teeny Tiny and his two brothers. Lost in the forest the three boys are welcomed by an ugly witch who appears to offer shelter. Only Teeny Tiny’s resourcefulness can save them from a dire fate. Based on the book by Barbara Walker.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gene Deitch, Morton Schindel, Kratky Film and Weston Woods Studios

results.title: Teens and AIDS: real people, real stories
results.creator_credit: Bradley Thompson, Alfred Higgins and Alfred Higgins Productions
results.brief_description: AIDS is the sixth leading cause of death for American youth aged between 15-24. This program interviews young men and women who are HIV positive and they discuss their experiences openly and frankly. The tape is aimed at teenage audiences and includes play performances devised by Young People Living With AIDS (Y.P.L.W.A.) which inform youth about safe sex, how to discuss safe sex and HIV status with prospective partners, and how to inform peers and family on HIV status.

results.title: Teenagers on trial
results.creator_credit: Frances Dinsmoor and RKO Pathe Pictures
results.brief_description: During the emergence of the “angry young man” stereotype in the 1950’s, this classroom film attempted to instruct the young on the evils of non-conformity and rebellion. By addressing such a complex issue in 8 minutes, the film’s main purpose was to promote discussion. Shows examples of various types of juvenile delinquency and makes a shallow attempt to illustrate some of the causes including crowded schools, negligent parents and tenement neighbourhoods.

results.title: Teenagers create an animated film
results.creator_credit: Larry Eikleberry, Maurice Prather and Centron Educational Films
results.brief_description: Documents the efforts of junior high school students in producing an animated film, “Gone with the antennas”. Shows the step-by-step process of how an animated film can be produced with a minimum of expense by a youthful group.
